title: On the piecewise complexity of words
abstract:
The piecewise complexity $h(u)$ of a word is the minimal length of subwords
needed to exactly characterise $u$. Its piecewise minimality index $\rho(u)$ is
the smallest length $k$ such that $u$ is minimal among its order-$k$ class
$[u]_k$ in Simon's congruence. We initiate a study of these two descriptive
complexity measures. Among other results we provide efficient algorithms for
computing $h(u)$ and $\rho(u)$ for a given word $u$.
subjects: Computer Science/Formal Languages and Automata Theory
